Learn how to define entities, DTOs, and: Learn how to define entities, DTOs, and attributes for your domain.
This guide explains how to define entiti: This guide explains how to define entities, DTOs, and attributes in MBC CQRS Serverless applications. Proper entity definition ensures type safety, clear separation of read and write operations, and maintainable code.
Use this guide when you need to:: Use this guide when you need to:

Define input validation for API endpoint: Define input validation for API endpoints

No type safety for entity attributes: No type safety for entity attributes
Same entity used for reads and writes ca: Same entity used for reads and writes causes confusion
Base classes include standard audit fiel: Base classes include standard audit fields
The framework provides three base entity: The framework provides three base entity classes:
Use Case: Return Data from API Queries: Use Case: Return Data from API Queries
Scenario: Your API needs to return produ: Scenario: Your API needs to return product information to the frontend.
Problem: Raw DynamoDB items lack type sa: Problem: Raw DynamoDB items lack type safety and may contain version suffixes in keys.
Solution: Use DataEntity to wrap query r: Solution: Use DataEntity to wrap query results with typed attributes and computed properties.
Use Case: Create or Update Data via Comm: Use Case: Create or Update Data via Commands
Scenario: User submits a form to create: Scenario: User submits a form to create a new product or update an existing one.
Problem: Need to structure data for Dyna: Problem: Need to structure data for DynamoDB command publishing with proper keys and version.
Solution: Use CommandEntity to structure: Solution: Use CommandEntity to structure write operations with required fields for CQRS command processing.
Scenario: Frontend requests a list of pr: Scenario: Frontend requests a list of products with pagination.
Problem: Need to return both the items a: Problem: Need to return both the items and total count for pagination UI.
Solution: Use DataListEntity to wrap lis: Solution: Use DataListEntity to wrap list results with total count and pagination cursor.
Use Case: Prepare Data for Command Publi: Use Case: Prepare Data for Command Publishing
Scenario: Service layer needs to create: Scenario: Service layer needs to create a command from validated input.
Solution: Use CommandDto to transform in: Solution: Use CommandDto to transform input data into the structure required by CommandService.
Use Case: Define Business Data Structure: Use Case: Define Business Data Structure
Scenario: Your entity has business-speci: Scenario: Your entity has business-specific fields like price, status, and shipping information.
Solution: Define TypeScript interfaces t: Solution: Define TypeScript interfaces that describe the structure of your domain data.
Scenario: API receives JSON from fronten: Scenario: API receives JSON from frontend and needs to validate before processing.
Problem: Invalid data (empty strings, ne: Problem: Invalid data (empty strings, negative prices) could corrupt your data store.
Solution: Use class-validator decorators: Solution: Use class-validator decorators to define validation rules that run automatically.
Use Case: Query Parameters for List and: Use Case: Query Parameters for List and Detail Endpoints
Scenario: Frontend sends query parameter: Scenario: Frontend sends query parameters for filtering, pagination, and detail lookups.
Solution: Define DTOs that validate quer: Solution: Define DTOs that validate query parameters and provide default values.

Scenario: Building an order management s: Scenario: Building an order management system with orders, items, shipping, and payment.
